answers.author: Maxwell Moline
answers.text:
Mark,
A lot of minor league teams do a lot with a little. A lot of it is just thinking or clever, funny ideas that will draw fans in, and from there you can really do a lot of things even on a small budget. For example, following Billy Donovan's famous waffle on leaving the Florida Gators to coach in Orlando, a local team had Billy Donovan night, where fans were allowed to "opt out" of their tickets, waffles were served, and a (different) man named Billy Donovan was slated to throw the first pitch, but took a different job at the last minute. 
Another Florida team had a mustache contest, where one week people came clean shaven and a week later came and a champion was crowned.
One team, to mock the rise of gas prices, priced their general admission tickets to correspond to the price of a gallon of gas, and their box seats were the cost of a gallon of premium.
Further descriptions of those and more promotions can be found at this link: http://baseball.about.com/od/minorleagues/a/mbpromotions1.htm
I hope that helps, good luck!

author: Mark Medlar
text: While teams in the top tier of American sports (NBA, NFL, etc.) have significant advertising and promotional budgets, teams in the minor leagues (or teams in less "mainstream" sports) often operate with limited resources.  Can anyone provide feedback as to how your community assists these smaller teams gain awareness and interest in their product?  Thank you.
title: Minor League Sports Promotion
